title: John Owen Maddox diary, 1 January-31 December 1917 - Page 1

und.value:
[Page 26]
Sunday 28
Came back to Bazentin in anticipation of leave but find it suspended as I said yesterday. The British are taking more front from the French.

Monday 29 H H S at Bazentin still waiting for leave but nothing is known of its re-opening.

Tuesday 30
Still waiting. Nothing of importance has occurred lately.

Wednesday 31
Weather beautifully fine with bright sunny days and clear moonlit nights, but very cold.

February, 1917

Saturday 3
Tonight I visited Pozieres & had a look over the old ground. Everything is clean and orderly but the graveyard has been greatly augmented. The night is moonlit and the snow still covers the ground. Battery of 9.2 is by our old aid Post.

Thursday 8
The weather is still fine but freezing cold and papers say that this is the coldest weather for many years. Fritz shells about us nightly & today about a quarter of a mile up the valley.

Friday 9
Leave passes arrive & in the best of spirits. Percy James & I move to D.H.Q. to report. We have to report again at 6pm.
Leave has been postponed again & I have to return to the unit very disappointed.

Saturday 10
Bemoaning my fate of yesterday. Rumours of a big raid are current.

Saturday 10

Bemoaning my fate of yesterday. Rumours of a big raid are current.
